title: Skydiving instructor dies after being separated from student, officials say
author: Livia Albeck-Ripka, The New York Times
bullets: National News The student, who had minor injuries, was rescued after being lodged in a tree in Nashville.
The instructor was “presumed to have fallen from the sky without a parachute,” police said.
Firefighters rescued a skydiver caught in a tree near the Ashland City Highway in Nashville on Saturday.

title: Pedestrian dies after being hit by BU shuttle bus
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The pedestrian became trapped under the bus and died at the scene.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A pedestrian was struck and killed on Monday morning in Boston’s South End neighborhood, police say.

title: Police seek suspects in 2 separate Boston stabbings
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime There are five suspects across the two incidents.
Boston police are seeking the public’s help in identifying suspects in two separate stabbing incidents.
Police are looking for one suspect in relation to a stabbing on Sept.

title: Police are searching for 13-year-old girl missing out of Dorchester
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News She went missing on Saturday.
Zaniya “Princess” Davis.
Boston Police Department ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Man clad in Boston gear sought in alleged theft of Amazon packages in Charlestown
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The suspect was wearing a Celtics jersey and a Bruins hat at the time of the alleged theft.
This gentleman in a Celtics shirt and Bruins hat allegedly stole four Amazon packages in Charlestown.
Boston Police Department ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Inside the Patriots’ locker room: What Mike Vrabel, Stefon Diggs said after dramatic win vs. Bills
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "I just have to keep reminding you every day we come to work of what you're capable of.
" Mike Vrabel prior to the Patriots' win over the Bills in Week 5.

AP Photo/Adrian Kraus By Hayden Bird October 6, 2025 | 8:50 AM 3 minutes to read Inside the Patriots’ locker room: The Patriots pulled off a stunning win in Buffalo to hand the reigning division champion Bills their first loss of the 2025 season on Sunday night, with a late Andy Borregales field goal ensuring a 23-20 victory.

title: Andy Borregales is ‘building some confidence’ with game-winning kick after rough start to season
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots “You can see when he’s building some confidence in his swing, it just looks good," coach MikeVrabel said.
Andy Borregales AP Photo/Gene J.
Puskar ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: What Stefon Diggs said about viral photo of him side-eying Josh Allen
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I was staring at him in the moment because it was like, ‘Damn, that was my brother.
'" Stefon Diggs Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff ShareSend this article to your social connections.

Returning to his old home, Stefon Diggs is the pivotal Patriot in their biggest win in years After statement win in Buffalo, Patriots might finally have their franchise QB in Drake Maye There’s a photo of Stefon Diggs from last year, looking at Josh Allen out of the side of his eye.

title: Rhamondre Stevenson rewards Mike Vrabel for sticking with him amid fumbling woes
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “That’s the story of life and football: adversity, being able to bounce back.
" Rhamondre Stevenson has fumbled three times this season.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan October 6, 2025 | 7:21 AM 3 minutes to read In a different Patriots regime, Rhamondre Stevenson likely would have been stapled to New England’s bench for a majority of Sunday’s game in Buffalo.

title: After statement win in Buffalo, Patriots might finally have their franchise QB in Drake Maye
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I see a young quarterback taking a step in the right direction.
" Drake Maye out-dueled Josh Allen on Sunday.
(AP Photo/Gene J.
